item.title: How to Get the Free Shattered Echo Blueprint in Black Ops 7 & Warzone
item.description:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Season 2 has brought a big wave of content for fans to get stuck into, from the debut of new maps and modes to a smaller update for Zombies fans. Whether you are trying to beat your highest round in Mars Survival, or grinding to unlock Mastery Camos on Season 2's roster of weapons, there's definitely a lot to keep players busy.

That's not all, though, as more content updates are rolling out. With the debut of the Week 3 Challenges for Black Ops 7 and Warzone also comes the final set of free rewards for Warzone , including a surprise free Weapon Blueprint that players can unlock. For those looking to get an additional cosmetic, here is how to get the Shattered Echo Blueprint in Black Ops 7 and Warzone .

How to Get Shattered Echo Blueprint in Black Ops 7 & Warzone

The Shattered Echo Blueprint is a reward that players can unlock through playing Call of Duty: Warzone exclusively. To get it, players will need to interact with 30 dropped items spawned from Cradle Drop Zones. Cradle Drop Zones take the form of red rifts that spawn in the sky, dropping various Loot Caches and sometimes vehicles.

Cradle Drop Zones spawn at purely random intervals in a match , sometimes up to three different times in a single game. However, while they do spawn in both Resurgence and Battle Royale, three separate rifts will spawn at a time in Battle Royale as opposed to a single one in Resurgence. This makes Battle Royale Casuals the best mode to play in order to get the Shattered Echo Blueprint fast , as you can find more dropped items this way.

Simply head to a Cradle Drop Zone and interact with a total of 30 dropped items: vehicles or Supply Caches that can be identified by the red smoke they give off, to unlock the Shattered Echo Blueprint for the Razor 9mm. On top of the Shattered Echo Blueprint, players can also unlock the Shattered Vision Decal by interacting with three dropped items in a single match, and the RedStorm Parachute by visiting a Drop Zone in five different matches.

The Shattered Echo Blueprint is not the only free reward available in Season 2. For a full breakdown of every reward you can get, check out our dedicated guide on all of Warzone's Season 2 Secret Challenges here.

item.title: 8 Perfect Final Fantasy Fan Games
item.description:
Final Fantasy began life on the Famicom in Japan before making its way to North America on the NES in 1990. Like most RPGs at the time, it had a niche following, but as the franchise grew and as RPGs in general started to get more of a fanbase, Final Fantasy became a top-tier name.

Now, Final Fantasy is easily one of the most recognizable RPG franchises of all time, which means there are a lot of fans out there who have their own ideas. There are plenty of hacks and mods for the mainline and spinoff Final Fantasy games. There are even some fan-made original games, so for those curious, let’s take a look at what the fan community has created.

"Perfect" is a bit of an exaggeration, but these fan games are perfect love letters to Final Fantasy.

Rearrange the covers into the correct US release order.

Your Order

Results

—

—

—

More Games
Rearrange the covers into the correct US release order.
Easy (5)Medium (7)Hard (10)

Your Order

Results

—
— —
More Games

Final Fantasy 7: Re-Imagined

Before Square Enix Got The Ball Rolling

  • Developer: PD Design Studio
  • Released: 2015
  • Based On: Final Fantasy 7

Final Fantasy 7: Re-Imagined got out before Final Fantasy 7 Remake , and it was the first real treat fans got who always wanted to see the original game through a new lens. The playable demo allowed players to be either Cloud or Tifa, who would go through a basic Shinra reactor level reimagined.

There was also a co-op option, and other characters could make an appearance, like Barret, to assist in the background. While the demo never went into full production as a game, PD Design Studio, the developer, did go on to launch an original creation called Dusty Raging Fist in 2019. Also, a beat ‘em up, it’s easy to see how Final Fantasy 7: Re-Imagined inspired it, so there is a positive end to this fan project.

AVALANCHE

Tifa May Cry

  • Developer: Rich Whitehouse
  • Released: 2008
  • Based On: Final Fantasy 7

AVALANCHE is a bit hard to Google and find sources for, but it is another Final Fantasy 7 fan project. This game stars Tifa, and instead of a 2D brawler, it’s a 3D action game akin to Devil May Cry . A better comparison may actually be Bayonetta since Tifa is a badass femme fatale, but either way, this is a combo-driven action platformer.

The level design is based on Shinra reactors like in Final Fantasy 7: Re-Imagined , but there’s more exploration and variation in the rooms. It’s just a demo, and it never went beyond that, but it’s still a pretty good idea. Of all the characters who should have received solo spinoffs from Final Fantasy 7 , Tifa should have been up there back in the mid-2000s.

Final Fantasy 7 Snowboarding

Getting Chilly On The Hills

  • Developer: Ákos Bécs
  • Released: 2020
  • Based On: Final Fantasy 7's Snowboarding Mini-Game

One of the most beloved mini-games from the original Final Fantasy 7 was a snowboarding game. At the time, snowboarding was hot on the PS1 thanks to Cool Boarders , and where the mini-game was placed in Final Fantasy 7 made sense. Final Fantasy 7 Snowboarding is then a remake of the mini-game where players can play as Cloud, Tifa, or Barret.

As a snowboarding game, it’s basic as a demo, but still fun in short bursts, and the polygonal redesigns of the characters are well done. It’s also worth noting that Square Enix has confirmed the final remake chapter will have snowboarding return as a mini-game.

Before Crisis: Cissnei -Final Mix- (Final Fantasy 7)

A Remake And A New Adaptation

Before Crisis: Final Fantasy 7 was released exclusively in Japan for mobile devices starting in 2004. It was a turn-based RPG prequel to the original game starring The Turks, and it was the only game in the compilation of Final Fantasy 7 that was never released in the West. Since the phone service it was under has gone away, so too has the game, making it a piece of lost media.

Square Enix is currently trying to remake parts of the game through Final Fantasy 7: Ever Crisis , but there are fan efforts as well. Before Crisis: Cissnei -Final Mix- (Final Fantasy 7) is a more faithful game to the original, which uses 2D original models and assets from other games. The goal, using RPG Maker, is to go through chapters focusing on different members of The Turks, with the current build largely focusing on Cissnei.

Final Fantasy 11: Braver

Going Off The MMO Grid

  • Developer: Mithrandir
  • Released: 2021
  • Based On: Final Fantasy 11

Final Fantasy 11 was the first MMO in the series, and it was released for the PC and PS2 in 2002 in Japan, and later in North America for the PC, PS2, and Xbox 360. While challenging, it collected a huge fanbase over time, which led to this fan project called Final Fantasy 11: Braver . It’s another game that uses RPG Maker , and unlike most fan projects on here, this is a full experience for a turn-based RPG.

Players can gather a party with various Jobs, and the world is all based on characters, places, and mechanics from Final Fantasy 11 . At one point, Square Enix was going to make a more pared-down version of Final Fantasy 11 called Final Fantasy 11 Mobile Reboot , but plans have since been canceled, like so many other Final Fantasy projects. Final Fantasy 11: Braver is the next best thing.

Triple Triad: Tournament Of The Elements

Final Fantasy 8’s Greatest Asset

  • Developer: UPRC
  • Released: 2021
  • Based On: Final Fantasy 8

Final Fantasy 8 was released in 1999 for the PS1, and while it definitely has its fans as one of the odder titles in the series, one thing stands out from it: Triple Triad. This card-based mini-game grew in popularity to the point that it was even included as a playable mini-game with Final Fantasy 14 , the second MMO. The fanbase got so big that there were numerous fan projects just based on Triple Triad alone.

Triple Triad: Tournament of the Elements is, without a doubt, the coolest example. Fans of the Game Boy Color game, Pokemon Trading Card Game , will feel right at home as this fan project has a similar gameplay setup and design. The world looks similar to Final Fantasy 6’s pixel art, and players can go around different areas, challenging original and fan favorite characters to card matches. The number of cards is triple that of Final Fantasy 8's collection, so Triple Triad: Tournament of the Elements is overall a big game.

Final Fantasy: Chronicles Of Eno

From D&D To FF

  • Developer: Thomas Kemp
  • Released: 2020
  • Based On: Final Fantasy As A Franchise

Final Fantasy: Chronicles of Eno is both an original game, just based on Final Fantasy as an overall concept, along with taking inspiration from a Dungeons & Dragons campaign. That said, there are characters from other games who appear, such as the Summon Diablo from Final Fantasy 8 .

It’s an ongoing project with a few playable chapters out, and it is using RPG Maker as the base game engine. It’s turn-based, players can have five characters in battle, which is rare for the series, and overall, it is quite impressive for a somewhat original fan project. Hopefully, the team gets to finish it one day or evolve it into something else, like how PD Design Studio transitioned Final Fantasy 7: Re-Imagined into Dusty Raging Fist .

Final Fantasy Renaissance

Remaking The Beginning

  • Developer: Renaissance Games
  • Released: 2024
  • Based On: Final Fantasy 1

Last, but not least, things can only end properly with the original Final Fantasy that started a global phenomenon. Final Fantasy Renaissance may look like a rom hack, but it is 100% made from the ground up and does not use the NES rom in any way other than the art style and the core game as the base idea.

The towns, world map, inventory system, and battle system look exactly like they did on the NES, but it plays much better, even though it is challenging. The game also starts with new Jobs to choose like one new example is the Lancer, which is based on the Dragoon. For anyone who loves Final Fantasy and wants to experience the magic of what the NES provided in 1990 for North Americans, but through a new lens, Final Fantasy Renaissance is the game to do it with.

item.title: How to Marry the Royal Frog in The Sims 4
item.description:
Various tales and legends were added to The Sims 4 with the Royalty and Legacy expansion pack. Players can find beautiful crystal shoes that will help them become the center of attention at the Grand Ball, they can pull a mighty sword from a rock if they prove themselves, and they can turn a frog into royalty.

This guide tells players how they can find the Royal Frog in The Sims 4 , whether they want to complete their in-game frog collection or break the curse.

How to Find the Royal Frog in The Sims 4

To find the Royal Frog in The Sims 4 , players won't have to go beyond searching logs; they will have to ask a special tree for the blessing of love . In Ondarion, the world in The Sims 4 Royalty and Legacy, players will find the Zanbira Tree in front of the Darong resident in the Dambele district. Players can ask this tree for various blessings, one of them being Novel Romance .

The Royal Frog will be added to a Sim's inventory in The Sims 4 when they successfully ask the Zanbira Tree for Novel Romance . It is not guaranteed that the Zanbira Tree will grant a Sim its blessing, but they are more likely to receive it if they view it prior to making the request.

If gamers want to get their hands on a Royal Frog quickly, but they keep getting denied by the Zanbira Tree, they can easily cheat for it. They only need to enable cheats in The Sims 4 , open the cheat pie menu, and then select "EP21 - Royalty & Legacy" > "Power Shift Events" > "[DEBUG] Create Noble Frog" - this will immediately add a Royal Frog to the Sim's inventory.

How to Turn the Royal Frog into a Noble in The Sims 4

Once Sims have a Royal Frog in their inventory, they can turn it into another Sim by interacting with it and selecting "Kiss Frog" . The frog that appears is based on the Sim's romantic preferences - if they prefer Women, the frog will turn into a female; if they prefer Men, a male Sim will appear; if they have no preference, either could show up.

However, turning the Royal Frog into a real Sim doesn't mean that the player's Sim will get their happy ending just yet. The former frog might not feel a connection with a Sim, or the Sim might be in a relationship, meaning the frog won't be interested in pursuing one with them. Either way, the frog will disappear from the Sim's inventory and their life. Thankfully, they will still be added to the Frog collection in their notebook.

If a Sim is single and the frog is willing to give their relationship a try, they will propose to the Sim on the spot . Frog Sims spawn at Level 7 of the Noble Career, which means this is a great way for Sims to marry their way into royalty.

7 /10

The Sims 4

item.title: Roblox: How to Train Your Dragon Codes (February 2026)
item.description:
In Roblox games, you can become almost anyone, and if you've ever dreamed of being a dragon tamer, then How to Train Your Dragon is the perfect experience for you. There you will be able to fly on different creatures from the famous DreamWorks film and participate in various activities. The game allows you to get some rewards for free by redeeming special coupons, which can be really helpful for beginners. In this guide, we will tell you about these How to Train Your Dragon codes and explain to you how to activate them.

Updated February 20, 2026, by Artur Novichenko: Several new codes have been added, bringing a fresh set of rewards to claim. You can get Gems, special coins, useful ingredients, and even different types of eggs and trait rolls. These bonuses can help you grow and improve your collection in different ways. We update this guide often, so make sure to come back and see if more rewards have been added.

All How to Train Your Dragon Codes

Working How to Train Your Dragon Codes

  • COOKING⁩ – Gives you Gems. (NEW)
  • THANKYOU20K⁩ – Gives you 5 of each ingredient. (NEW)
  • SNOGGLETOG – Gives you 150 Snoggletog coins. (NEW)
  • YAKNOG – Gives you 1 of each Yaknog ingredient. (NEW)
  • SKRILLISSUE – Gives you x1 Trait Rolls.
  • GEMS – Gives you 500 Gems.
  • SORRY4DELAY – Gives you x1 Wave Egg.
  • MORETRAITS – Gives you x3 Trait Rerolls.
  • ABCDEF – Gives you x1 Rare Egg with 4x Luck.
  • DRAGONS4L – Gives you x2 Trait Rolls.

Expired How to Train Your Dragon Codes

Currently, How to Train Your Dragon doesn’t have expired promo codes. If any of these coupons become unavailable to you and other users, we will update this paragraph and list them here.

In How to Train Your Dragon , you can hatch different eggs to get new mounts and use special Trait Rolls to obtain new passive bonuses. Promo codes can provide you with free eggs and rolls, and we highly recommend you redeem them as soon as possible.

How to Redeem How to Train Your Dragon Codes

Codes in How to Train Your Dragon can provide you with useful bonuses, and fortunately, the redemption process in this Roblox game is very simple. However, before you can activate these coupons, you will have to reach a certain level. Here is a list of steps you need to follow to redeem How to Train Your Dragon codes and claim your freebies:

  • Launch How to Train Your Dragon and wait for the game to load.
  • Complete a couple of quests to reach Level 2. After that, the redemption menu will be unlocked.
  • Click on the Codes button in the upper left corner of the screen.
  • Enter the code you want to redeem.
  • Click on the Claim button.
  • The reward is yours.

How to Get New How to Train Your Dragon Codes

The How to Train Your Dragon developers may add new promo codes in the future, and we will try to keep our article updated with all the latest freebies. Feel free to bookmark this guide and use it as a source of information about coupons in this game. Also, you can follow the official How to Train Your Dragon media:

  • Roblox Group
  • Discord Server
Roblox

item.title: Roblox Axia Codes (February 2026)
item.description:
Embark on an enchanting journey in Roblox's Axia , a captivating simulator where you chop through realms to gather resources, brew potions, and evolve your character into a legendary adventurer. Begin in landscapes teeming with ancient trees and hidden treasures, using your axe to harvest wood and ores that fuel epic upgrades like boosts and magic finds. Unlock new areas such as sky lands or oak biomes, battle foes for rare drops, and watch your power skyrocket with every potion.

Team up with friends for faster farms or compete on leaderboards to claim the top spot, which are made easier with working codes. Codes are essential because they grant free potions and items instantly, speeding up your progress so you evolve quicker, explore farther, and dominate realms without endless chopping sessions.

Updated February 20, 2026, by Artur Novichenko: A new code has just been added, giving you access to powerful OP Potions. You can also redeem other active codes for special evolution potions and a valuable Formula of Life. These rewards can support your progress and help you strengthen your setup. This guide is updated regularly, so feel free to return later for more potential bonuses.

All Axia Codes

Working Axia Codes

  • VALENTINES – OP Potions (NEW)
  • SKYLANDS – 5 Beyond Evolution Potions
  • ELDEROAK – 1 Formula of Life

Expired Axia Codes

  • RELEASE! – 2 Fortune II Potions, 2 Magic Find II Potions, 2 Power II Potions, 2 Speed II Potions

Roblox codes and the rewards they provide are incredibly vital in Axia , offering immediate access to high-value items like Beyond Evolution Potions that transform your basic gear into god-tier tools capable of harvesting massive hauls, while Fortune II and Magic Find II Potions dramatically increase drop rates for rare ores during long grinding sessions.

Without these freebies, new adventurers might spend hours on repetitive chopping with low yields, feeling stuck before unlocking evolutions, but codes bridge that gap beautifully, empowering players.

How to Redeem Axia Codes

  • Launch Axia on Roblox and join the game.
  • Press the blue bird Codes button on the left side of your screen.
  • Input a code into the Enter Codes field.
  • Hit Redeem and enjoy your free potions instantly.

How to Get More Axia Codes

Join the Willow Studio Discord server for direct updates. We keep this guide refreshed with the newest codes for this Roblox game, so bookmark this page and check back every few days—that's the simplest way to snag new rewards first and keep evolving ahead of everyone else.
